page.title: 04WILDLIFE
page.content: {WOODLAND:}A major habitat in the area is deciduous woodland. This shelters grey squirrels, rabbits, voles, mice and a few deer. Badgers are to be found, but are getting rare, while foxes seem to be increasing throughout the area. Birds include owls, finches, pigeons, warblers, nuthatches and crows. Insect species are moths, bugs, butterflies, beetles and ants. {MEADOW:}The the most common habitat in the area, this houses rabbits and mice as well as many types of insect. The hedgerows house hedgehogs and numerous birds such as starlings and sparrows. {PONDS:}Several ponds are home to carp, roach, tench, the common frog, newts, toads and a few grass snakes. On the surface there are pondskaters and below there are diving beetles and water snails. Herons and kingfishers feed on the fish in the pond.
